availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Harry Innes Todd (Frankfort, Kentucky, merchant, sheriff, and lessee of the Kentucky Penitentiary)

body.p: Frankfort, Franklin County, Kentucky, merchant, sheriff, and lessee of the Kentucky State Penitentiary. Franklin County, Kentucky, native. Son of John H. Todd and Maria K. Innes. Married Jane B. Davidson Todd in Franklin County, Kentucky, on August 20, 1839. Father of Harriet D. Todd, Ann J. Todd, John H. Todd, Chapman Todd, Harry J. Todd, Julia R. Todd, Maria C. Todd, George D. Todd, and Jenny Todd. Merchant in Franklin County in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1850. Elected sheriff of Franklin county in 1859. Merchant in Frankfort in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1860. Lessee of the Kentucky State Penitentiary from 1863 to 1871.

ab.bibl:
